SEARCH
Module iu.util.runtime
Package edu.iu.runtime

Interface IuRuntimeConfiguration

public interface IuRuntimeConfiguration
Provides uniform access to runtime configuration.

Expected Types

The underlying configuration value must be appropriate for the expected type, otherwise IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

Atomic Types

The following atomic types must be supported:

  • BigDecimal
  • BigInteger
  • Boolean
  • Date
  • Instant
  • Integer
  • LocalDate
  • LocalDateTime
  • LocalTime
  • Long
  • Number
  • Pattern
  • String
  • Year
  • YearMonth
  • ZonedDateTime

Collection Types

The following collection types must be supported:

  • Array
  • Collection
  • DoubleStream
  • IntStream
  • Iterable
  • List
  • LongStream
  • Set
  • SortedSet
  • Stream

When handing collection types, an implementation:

  • Must convert atomic values from the underlying configuration source to a singleton when a collection type is expected.
  • Must use ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType.getGenericComponentType(), or Class.getComponentType() to determine the expected type of items in the collection.
  • Must not return an empty collection instead of throwing IllegalArgumentException when the reference cannot be resolved.

Named Value Types

The following named value collection types must be supported:

  • IuRuntimeConfiguration
  • Map

When handing named value collection types, an implementation:

  • Must convert atomic types from the underlying configuration source to a singleton with an empty (non-null) name when a named value type is expected and only one value is provided.
  • Must convert collection types from the underlying configuration source to a named value collection using the non-negative integer index values implied by the underlying collection's iterator as names.
  • Must return all configured values relative to the reference when IuRuntimeConfiguration is used. The resulting configuration must only understand references relative to the resulting configuration.
  • Must use ParameterizedType to determine the expected type of named values when a generic Map is used.
  • Should support the use of qualified Java module, package, and type names to resolve specific configuration subsets when using IuRuntimeConfiguration as the expected type.

Jakarta JSON-P Types

The following types from the Jakarta JSON-P API should be supported.

  • JsonArray (collection)
  • JsonNumber
  • JsonString
  • JsonStructure
  • JsonObject (named value)
  • JsonPointer
  • JsonValue

JSON Pointer should be a supported configuration reference format.

Serialized Form

All atomic and collection configuration values must be retrievable using the String type.

  • Values with an underlying collection type should use CSV format when converting to String.
  • A null value implies that an explicit null was defined by the underlying configuration source.
  • An empty string value implies an empty collection.
  • An empty string literal (two double quote characters "") implies a singleton collection with an empty string value.

Attempted retrieval of a value with an underlying named value collection type using String should result in IllegalArgumentException being thrown.

Null Values

Implementations should support null values when a reference resolved to an explicit null in the configuration source. A null value does not imply that configuration is missing.

For example, an application can use the Void type to check for the presence of a null configuration value. 

 try {
     config.getValue(reference, Void.class);
     // The value is defined
 } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
     // The value is not defined
 }

Security Considerations

When throwing IllegalArgumentException, an implementation:

  • Should not include the unresolved reference in the message.
  • Must not include any configuration values in the a message.
